other_tests.findings: More than 50 small adenomas identified in the right side of the colon; two large adenomas measuring more than 1 cm at the hepatic flexure and in the rectosigmoid colon.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Normal colonoscopic examination four years earlier revealed no polyps.

other_tests.findings: Tubulovillous adenoma in the ampulla of Vater measuring 0.8 cm.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Progressed to require a right colectomy showing a tubulovillous adenoma in the ascending colon measuring 5.0 cm and multiple small tubular adenomas.

other_tests.findings: 50 to 100 small flat polyps carpeting the cecum and the right side of the colon, including both serrated adenomas and tubular adenomas.

other_tests.procedure_name: Endoscopic examination of stomach and duodenum
other_tests.findings: Fundic-gland polyps in the stomach and a tubular adenoma in the duodenum.
Identified germ-line truncating mutation in the APC gene in the patient's father; no mutation found in the patient indicating she does not have attenuated familial adenomatous polyposis.
